CatDescriptText: Miss Elizabeth White, 1101 Wheeler Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "It seems to me that in Negro neighborhoods there are more illegally operated places, mainly because the colored residents do not have the same economic opportunities as the whites. Therefore, there are more raids.
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elizabeth White wearing earrings, light colored short sleeve shirt, and plaid skirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
